com.undercamber

Class TestSetBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.undercamber.TestSetBuilder

  • public final class TestSetBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    Configure a test set.

    This class configures the environment that is used during the second pass.

    See Also:
    Configurator.getEmptyTestSetBuilder()

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TestSetBuilder(TestSetBuilder original)
      Create a copy

    • Method Detail

      • setTestSetName

        public final void setTestSetName(java.lang.String testSetName)
                          throws UserError,
                                 InternalException
        Set the name of the test set.

        This is equivalent to

            setTestSetName( testSetName,
                    ValidationLevel.ERROR );
        Parameters:
        testSetName - The name.
        Throws:
        UserError - If the name is not valid, or if the string is improperly formatted for expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • setTestSetName

        public final void setTestSetName(java.lang.String testSetName,
                                 ValidationLevel validationLevel)
                          throws UserError,
                                 InternalException
        Set the name of the test set.
        Parameters:
        testSetName - The name.
        validationLevel - The validation level to use when expanding the string.
        Throws:
        UserError - If the name is not valid, or if the string is improperly formatted for expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • setJVMDirectoryName

        public final void setJVMDirectoryName(java.lang.String jvmDirectoryName)
                               throws UserError,
                                      InternalException
        Set the name of the JVM directory to be used in the second pass.

        Undercamber will look for the Java executable in the bin subdirectory below the specified directory.

        Unlike setJVMDirectory(java.io.File), this method uses string expansion.

        This is equivalent to

            setJVMDirectoryName( jvmDirectoryName,
                         ValidationLevel.ERROR )
        Parameters:
        jvmDirectoryName - The directory name
        Throws:
        UserError - If the string is not properly formatted for string expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • setJVMDirectoryName

        public final void setJVMDirectoryName(java.lang.String jvmDirectoryName,
                                      ValidationLevel validationLevel)
                               throws UserError,
                                      InternalException
        Set the name of the JVM directory to be used in the second pass.

        Undercamber will look for the Java executable in the bin subdirectory below the specified directory.

        Unlike setJVMDirectory(java.io.File), this method uses string expansion.

        Parameters:
        jvmDirectoryName - The directory name
        validationLevel - The validation level to use for string expansion
        Throws:
        UserError - If the string is not properly formatted for string expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • setJVMDirectory

        public final void setJVMDirectory(java.io.File jvmDirectory)
        Set the JVM directory.

        Undercamber will look for the Java executable in the 

        bin
        subdirectory below the specified directory.

        Unlike setJVMDirectoryName(java.lang.String), this method does not use string expansion.

        Parameters:
        jvmDirectory - The JVM directory

      • setPass2ThreadCount

        public final void setPass2ThreadCount(java.lang.Integer threadCount)
        Set the thread count to be used during the second pass.
        Parameters:
        threadCount - The thread count. If this is null, Undercamber will use a default value.

      • getPass2ThreadCount

        public final java.lang.Integer getPass2ThreadCount()
        Get the thread count used during the second pass.
        Returns:
        The thread count. If this is null, Undercamber will use a default value.

      • setTestParameters

        public final void setTestParameters(java.util.List<java.lang.String> testParameters)
        Set the test parameters in this test set.

        This method does not use string expansion.

        Parameters:
        testParameters - The set of parameters to be used for the test set. The internal list is replace by the provided list, so updates to the list outside of this class will be reflected in the list.

      • clearTestParameters

        public final void clearTestParameters()
        Remove all test parameters.

      • getTestParameters

        public final java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTestParameters()
        Get the list of test parameters.

        This returns the internal list, so updates to the list outside of this class will be reflected in the list.

        Returns:
        The list of parameters.

      • appendTestParameterPair

        public final void appendTestParameterPair(java.lang.String flag,
                                          Path path)
                                   throws UserError,
                                          InternalException
        Append two entries to the list of test parameters.

        This is equivalent to

            appendTestParameterPair( flag,
                             path,
                             ValidationLevel.ERROR )
        Parameters:
        flag - The first parameter to append
        path - The second parameter to append. No string expansion is applied to this.
        Throws:
        UserError - If the string is not properly formatted for string expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • prependJavaParameters

        public final void prependJavaParameters(java.lang.String... parameters)
                                 throws UserError,
                                        InternalException
        Prepend multiple Java parameters
        Parameters:
        parameters - The parameters to prepend
        Throws:
        UserError - If the string is not properly formatted for string expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • appendJavaParameterPair

        public final void appendJavaParameterPair(java.lang.String flag,
                                          Path path)
                                   throws UserError,
                                          InternalException
        Append two entries to the list of java parameters.

        This is equivalent to

            appendJavaParameterPair( flag,
                             path,
                             ValidationLevel.ERROR )
        Parameters:
        flag - The first parameter to append
        path - The second parameter to append. No string expansion is applied to this.
        Throws:
        UserError - If the string is not properly formatted for string expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

                                          InternalException

        path - The second parameter to append. No string expansion is applied to this.
        Throws:
        UserError - If the string is not properly formatted for string expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • setEnvironmentVariables

        public final void setEnvironmentVariables(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> environmentVariables)
        Set the environment variables.

        The internal Map is replaced by the provided map, so subsequent modifications to the map outside of this class will be reflected in the internal map.

        If environmentVariables is null, Undercamber will use the environment variables inherited from the operating system.

        This method does not perform any string expansion.

        Parameters:
        environmentVariables - The environment variables

      • clearEnvironmentVariables

        public final void clearEnvironmentVariables()
        Remove all environment variables. This implies the test set will have no environment variables. Contrast this with deleteEnvironmentVariables(), which implies defaults.

      • deleteEnvironmentVariables

        public final void deleteEnvironmentVariables()
        Set the internal representation to null, implying defaults. Contrast this with clearEnvironmentVariables(), which implies no environment variables.

      • getEnvironmentVariables

        public final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getEnvironmentVariables()
        Get the environment variables.

        This method returns the internal map, so subsequent modification to the map outside of this class will be reflected in the internal map.

        Returns:
        The environment variables. If this is null, it implies Undercamber will use the environement variables inherited from the operating system.

      • addEnvironmentVariable

        public final void addEnvironmentVariable(java.lang.String name,
                                         java.lang.String value)
                                  throws UserError,
                                         InternalException
        Add an environment variable.

        This is equivalent to

            addEnvironmentVariable( name,
                            value,
                            ValidationLevel.ERROR );
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        value - The value of the environment variable
        Throws:
        UserError - If the strings are not properly formatted for string expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • addEnvironmentVariable

        public final void addEnvironmentVariable(java.lang.String name,
                                         java.lang.String value,
                                         ValidationLevel validationLevel)
                                  throws UserError,
                                         InternalException
        Add an environment variable.

        If the internal representation is null (implying defaults), a new internal Map will be created.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        value - The value of the environment variable
        validationLevel - The validation level to use when expanding the strings.
        Throws:
        UserError - If the strings are not properly formatted for string expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • addEnvironmentVariable

        public final void addEnvironmentVariable(java.lang.String name,
                                         Path path)
                                  throws UserError,
                                         InternalException
        Add an environment variable.

        This is equivalent to

            addEnvironmentVariable( name,
                            path,
                            ValidationLevel.ERROR );
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the environment variable
        path - The value of the environment variable. There is no string expansion on this argument.
        Throws:
        UserError - If the strings are not properly formatted for string expansion.
        InternalException - If there is an internal problem expanding the string.

      • copyEnvironmentVariable

        public final void copyEnvironmentVariable(java.lang.String environmentVariable)
                                   throws UserError
        A convenience method to copy an environment variable from the system environment to the environment used in the second pass.
        Parameters:
        environmentVariable - The name of the environment variable to copy into the second-pass environment.
        Throws:
        UserError - If the environment variable does not exist.

      • copyEnvironmentVariableIfPresent

        public final void copyEnvironmentVariableIfPresent(java.lang.String environmentVariable)
        A convenience method to copy an environment variable from the system environment to the environment used in the second pass.

        This method does nothing if the specified environment variable does not exist.

        Parameters:
        environmentVariable - The name of the environment variable to copy into the second-pass environment.

      • createTestSet

        public final void createTestSet()
        Create a test set and add it to the Undercamber system.

        The newly created test set will use copies of the internal data in this TestSetBuilder, so subsequent updates to this TestSetBuilder object will not be reflected in the test set created by this call.
